metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: It is suggested to have a dedicated virtual environment for each Django project, and one way to manage a virtual environment is venv , which is included in Python.
content.html: It is suggested to have a dedicated virtual environment for each Django project, and one way to manage a virtual environment is venv, which is included in Python.

content.text: The name of the virtual environment is your choice, in this tutorial we will call it myworld .
content.html: The name of the virtual environment is your choice, in this tutorial we will call it myworld.

content.text: Type the following in the command prompt, remember to navigate to where you want to create your project:
content.html: Type the following in the command prompt, remember to navigate to where you want to create your project:

content.code_html: python -m venv myworld

content.text: This will set up a virtual environment, and create a folder named "myworld" with subfolders and files, like this:
content.html: This will set up a virtual environment, and create a folder named "myworld" with subfolders and files, like this:

content.code_html:
myworld
  Include
  Lib
  Scripts
  .gitignore
  pyvenv.cfg

content.text: Then you have to activate the environment, by typing this command:
content.html: Then you have to activate the environment, by typing this command:

content.text: Once the environment is activated, you will see this result in the command prompt:
content.html: Once the environment is activated, you will see this result in the command prompt:

content.text: Note: You must activate the virtual environment every time you open the command prompt to work on your project.
content.html: Note: You must activate the virtual environment every time you open the command prompt to work on your project.

content.text: In the next chapter you will finally learn how to install Django!
content.html: In the next chapter you will finally learn how to install Django!

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
